Key Match Events: Tari Eason had a career game, scoring 27-points in 35 minutes on 11-of-19 shooting, and had three blocks, four steals, and nine rebounds.
Post-Match Reflections: Eason truly showed his dislike for the Warriors, as he had a really clutch steal while having five fouls early in the fourth to give the Rockets momentum, playing a major role in Houston's attempted 31-point comeback.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Eason's steal percentage is first in the NBA, he is first among forwards in the league in block percentage, as well as being in the 97th percentile amongst forwards in offensive rebounds. Houston is also 12.1 points better per 100 possessions when he is on the floor.
Others: Ime Udoka iced Alperen Sengun last night by only playing him for 21 minutes, and showed he is not scared to go deep into the rotation.
